p: Addition of each of the oregano preparations also slightly limited the growth of bacteria from the Enterobacteriaceae family in BAADER meat (Table 5). The most effective in this respect was the essential oil (EOS) and 70% ethanol extract (E70). In all BAADER meat samples, significantly ( p < 0.05) the highest number of Enterobacteriaceae bacteria was determined after 2 months of storage. Extending the storage period to 6 and 9 months resulted in a significant ( p < 0.05) reduction in the number of these microorganisms.
